title: Linux hash Command with Practical Examples
description: Explore the Linux hash command and learn how to calculate hashes of files and directories, as well as verify file integrity using hash checksums.

meta.title: Linux hash Command with Practical Examples
meta.description: Explore the Linux hash command and learn how to calculate hashes of files and directories, as well as verify file integrity using hash checksums.
meta.keywords: Linux, hash, file integrity, checksum, hashing, utilities

steps.title: Introduction to the Linux hash Command

verify.name: Verify the hash command version
verify.hint: The hash command version should be GNU coreutils 8.32.

steps.title: Calculating Hashes of Files and Directories

verify.name: Verify the hash of sample.txt
verify.hint: The SHA-256 hash of the sample.txt file should be 5d10c2c4d3dc5711938f617416b2b523c4d4f3ecd85a13d7c0c6f88a45b6ebc.

verify.name: Verify the integrity of sample.txt and sample_dir
verify.hint: The calculated hash values for sample.txt and sample_dir should match the expected values in the sample_checksums.txt file.
